Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Thank \Thank\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Thanked}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Thanking}.] [AS. [thorn]ancian. See {Thank}, n.] To express gratitude to (anyone) for a favor; to make acknowledgments to (anyone) for kindness bestowed; -- used also ironically for blame. [1913 Webster]
``Graunt mercy, lord, that thank I you,'' quod she. --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]
I thank thee for thine honest care. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
Weigh the danger with the doubtful bliss, And thank yourself if aught should fall amiss. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
